skill.name: data-storytelling
skill.description: Transform data into compelling narratives using visualization, context, and persuasive structure. Use when presenting analytics to stakeholders, creating data reports, or building executive presentations.
skill.summary: Transform data into compelling narratives using visualization, context, and persuasive structure. Us...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: The skill is a Markdown guide with frameworks, templates, and phrasing examples. No code execution, file access, or network activity is present.

content.user_title: Create clear data stories for stakeholders
content.value_statement: Stakeholders often miss the point when data is shown without a narrative. This skill provides structures and phrasing to turn metrics into actionable stories.
actual_capabilities: Explains setup, conflict, resolution story structure
Provides a narrative arc from hook to call to action
Offers problem solution, trend, and comparison frameworks
Lists visualization techniques like progressive reveal and contrast
Includes executive summary and dashboard templates
Supplies headline, transition, and uncertainty phrasing examples
limitations: Does not analyze data or compute metrics
Does not generate charts, slides, or reports
Requires user supplied context and accurate numbers
Does not validate statistical significance or causality

use_cases.title: Executive update story
use_cases.description: Turn quarterly metrics into a concise narrative for leadership decisions.

use_cases.title: Investor traction narrative
use_cases.description: Frame growth and retention data into a persuasive investor story.

use_cases.title: Insight report outline
use_cases.description: Structure a data report with clear findings and recommended actions.

prompt_templates.title: Simple problem story
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the problem solution framework to tell a story about churn. Metrics: churn 8.5 percent, industry 5 percent, 500 customers left.

prompt_templates.title: Trend narrative
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a trend story for Q4 performance. Include hook, context, key insight, and recommendation. Metrics: MRR 1.2M to 1.6M, trial to paid 8 to 15 percent.

prompt_templates.title: Comparison decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a comparison story for EMEA versus APAC. Use weighted factors: size 25, growth 30, competition 20, ease 25. Provide a recommendation.

prompt_templates.title: Executive summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft an executive summary slide with key insight, data, implication, and ask. Insight: onboarding week one raises LTV 3x. Budget request 75K.

output_examples.input: Summarize our Q4 revenue story with a clear recommendation
output: Headline: Q4 revenue rose after self serve changes
Key insight: Self serve plus success calls drove higher expansion
Recommendation: Double down on the hybrid model and target 1.8M MRR

best_practices: Lead with the key insight before details
Use visuals to highlight contrasts and changes
End with a specific action or decision
anti_patterns: Listing metrics without a narrative arc
Burying the main insight at the end

faq.question: Is it compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a text based skill that works in any chat interface.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not analyze data or produce charts. It guides structure and wording.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my BI tools?
faq.answer: No direct integration. Use your tool outputs as inputs to the prompts.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: The skill does not access files or networks. You control what you paste.

faq.question: What if the story feels generic?
faq.answer: Add specific metrics, audience goals, and a concrete decision to improve focus.

faq.question: How does this compare to a slide generator?
faq.answer: It provides narrative structure and wording, not automated slide creation.
